feels.name: Anxiety
feels.quote: Language cannot describe the anxieties, experiences, and exertions which Jo underwent that morning.

feels.name: Exhaustion
feels.quote: The unusual spectacle of her busy mother rocking comfortably, and reading, early in the morning, made Jo feel as if some natural phenomenon had occurred.

feels.name: Embarrassment
feels.quote: Poor Jo would gladly have gone under the table, as one thing after another was tasted and left.

feels.name: Grief
feels.quote: Beth sobbing over Pip, the canary, who lay dead in the cage.

feels.name: Relief
feels.quote: Meg ran upstairs, and soon came back again, looking relieved, but rather bewildered, and a little ashamed.

feels.name: Disappointment
feels.quote: Amy giggled, Meg looked distressed, Miss Crocker pursed up her lips, and Laurie talked and laughed with all his might, to give a cheerful tone to the festive scene.

Places.name: Kitchen
Places.description: In a most discouraging state of confusion.

Places.name: Parlor
Places.description: Where Beth sobbed over the dead canary.

Places.name: Dining_room
Places.description: Where the failed dinner was served.
